text:
Hi <@U6W3H6YN8> and <@U012W4YEUTX>,

Thank you so much for your response.

Please refresh the below URL again. Now you can see the list of Items.

<https://www.columbusglobal.com/en/news-detail>

In the below code, the highlighted in bold is the anchor tag which we need to redirect to another page with a User-friendly URL.

Currently, it was returning *404 Not found* as there is no webpage.

But here how can I achieve User-friendly URL's when we click on each item separated by a slash (/) as like default functionality of webpage /landing page / Blog


_<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">_
_<table>_
  _<tr ng-repeat="x in releases">_
    _<td>  {% raw %} {{ x.id }} {% endraw %}</td>_
    _<td>{% raw %} *<a href="/en/news-detail/{{x.title}}/{{x.id}}"> {{ x.title }}</a>{% endraw %}*</td>_
    _<td ng-bind-html="x.body"></td>_
    _<td>{% raw %}{{ x.type }}{% endraw %}</td>_
  _</tr>_
  _<tr><td colspan="4">{{ request.query_dict.id }}</td></tr>_
_</table>_
_</div>_


Thanks in Advance,
Sanjay

I am looking at the <#C2YHAHB6K|api> docs, <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>.

I’m primarily interested in CMS apis, and it seems like a lot of them are “under constructions.” Is there an upcoming V3 API, or what’s going on.

Right now, it’s confusing trying to get a definitive answer from the docs. What I’m doing is more forward looking, so I want to know where we are going.
Hi <@U012W4YEUTX>, thanks very much for the response. Do you know where I can find these libs?

Bottom of this: <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/overview> .

Ctrl-F for "Client Libraries".
Basically, it is like this GIF, but for V3 APIs.

I can find this in legacy docs, but having a hard time finding it in the new documentation. Any quick help?
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/lists/create_list>
